Small code to update existing databases and ensure that all indices are created
Fix aposraphe bug + release code

NOTE: This version has 'DEBUG ONLY' code enabled.

The big changes here are:

- progress dialog when looking up ISBN (and using AsyncTask).
- work flow change -- scanning a book or entering an ISBN goes
straight back to the scanner or data entry screen. This more closely
represents my work pattern, but may not be generally true.

Source code changes:

BookCatalogue:

1. Changed OnGroupClickListener to OnGroupExpandListener because both
Click and Collapse were firing on a collapse, making the lists get out
of sync.
2. Replaced addToCurrentGroup with adjustCurrentGroup to more reliably
track group open/close.
3. revised createBookScan so that it calls BookISBNSearch to manage
the barcode scanning.

BookISBNSearch:

1. Now uses ProgressDialog. Removed mIsbnStatus and related dialog
field.
2. Added code to support scanning barcodes from this activity.
3. Added a SearchForBookTask class based on AsyncTask to do ISBN
lookups.

CatalogueDBAdapter:

1. Added some CAse Insensitive indices (suffix _ci). Possibly need to
add more. Note that COLLATE NOCASE does not work with Unicode (I
believe).
2. Modified fetchAuthorPositionByName to use case insentitive matchh
and order so position is correct when comparing 'de Camp' with
'Zelazny'.

Changed collation, fixed bug in returning intent when manually
entering ISBN.
This duplicate line causes a crash when importing my old data

Ensure that expanding category headings in search results gives
correct list of books.
Needed for changed work-flow. Forgot to include in earler commit.

Save all open and closed groups on exit/pause. Prevents last book
always opening even if group was closed.

Monitor currentGroup.size() to endure Expand/Collapse menu item is
always correct, as per Issue 150.

Substantial restructure of BookCatalogue.java to remove redundant code
and keep view-related code in one place where possible. All views now
share same code for visibility

Code restructure to remove redundant code and make sure visibility
handling is consistent. This addresses Issue 163.

Bug fix to deal with possibility that the AsyncTask completes *while*
screen is being rotated and before Activity is reconstructed.
Put square brackets around series name for all but 'series' sort view.

Initial version using Fields (and related) objects to manage
validation and data display.

- each Field in a Fields object corresponds to a data-related UI
element.
- They can have custom data accessors, formatting and validation
- book update/create now uses a ContentValues collection
- google and amazon search now share a ContentValues object to return
results
- import uses the column headers to construct a ContentValues
collection rather than using hard-coded column numbers

prevent application hangs.

Mainly useful
when id=0.

Note: The LibraryThing api requires a developer key. This is contained
in the module
LibraryThingApiKey which contains a single method:

public class LibraryThingApiKey {
static String get() { return '<api-key-from-librarything>'; };
}

Mail has been sent to LibraryThing asking what to do about public
code. For the time being,
each developer should ask for an API key and make a local module, or
put dummy text in this
string since covers thumbnails still work with a dummy string.

If data conversion fails, store as string.

Existing code tried to force a text value to match the database type;
failure resulted in an FC. Now failure results in the string
representation being stored.

Validation improvements.

- Require author and title (again) since field-based validation became
advisory.

Fixed crashed in Android 1.6.

names. Manually set column names and now working.

Improved search logic when searching by author/title, increased
ability to capture better data.

- Searches site-by-site for ISBN, then does remaining sites.
- If two dates are available and the current is not parseable, it
tries the new one.

Better handling of cancellation.

- no extra searches done
- book wont be added

can now be long-clicked to produce a context menu which allows global

All of the above because COLLATE UNICODE does not seem to do case
folding when comparing text. It DOES do it when sorting text; but
tests seem to indicate 'LE GUIN' != 'le guin' even though they sort as
if equal.

Bug fixes when many fields hidden; bug fixes and cleanup to code
allowing book to be in two position in same series.

1. When many fields were hidden, getting values from UI Spinners
resulted
in unexpected null values. Similarly, date_published was stored and
retrieved as null causing conversion routines to fail.

2. Modified interface used in Utils.pruneList to support a new method
instead of manually checking the name string (I have some authors with
brackets in their names). Also, modified DB code that stores series to
allow more than one entry for the same series. Finally, changed the
unique index on book_series to include series_num.

NOTE: This update will crash if used with a database created a
previous non-production version if books are added to the same series
more than once.

Reduced chances of memory leaks by reducing refs to activities.

Where possible, used application context and kept weak reference to
Activity. Removed Fields' references to View objects, made ref to
Activity a WeakReference.

Support for user-based LibraryThing dev keys.

- Dialog to ask user about LT
- Uses LT if available.
- New admin page.

Changed book description to unlimited size, added reset on disabled
messages, added ScrollView to admin pages.

- The description size is now unlimited (was 5 lines). Did this
because scrolling was not working properly (it's inside a ScrollView).
Not sure it's better, but I think I prefer it.

- Added ScrollView to admin pages that were too long in landscape
mode.

Removed interrelated class-level values that may have become out of
sync.

- ViewManager and the list adapter were possibly getting out of sync.
Now they cant.

- Authors and series were not being purged after a book was deleted.

Release changes
Release changes
Release changes

Gather (and email) more debug info.

- onUpgrade now copies the DB at the *start* of processing if it is an
upgrade, and gives it a unique name based on the original version.

- The help page now has a 'Send Information' button which will copy
the DB, and create a mail message with the DB and any log files
attached. The string, debug_email, can be a ';'-separated list of
email address to receive emails.

- The Help page now has a 'Cleanup Files' button which will cleanup
any log files or DB backups.
Avoid crashes on upgrade from DB version 41 to current.

Fixes for issues 200, 201, and 202.

- 200: Exceptions are now thrown again (after logging) in onUpgrade.
This allows the caller to know the upgrade failed and prevent partial
DB updates.

- 201: Export.csv is now sent as part of the debug info email

- 202: Duplicate books will no longer be displayed when the same book
appears multiple times in the same series. It will still appear
multiple times when in the sort-by-series view.

Fix duplicate authors

Fix for Issue 214; work-around for probable bug in Honeycomb.

It seems that Honeycomb releases cursors in Activitiy objects which
have been passed to startManagingObjects() but the underlying users of
those cursors (eg. intrinsic Android adapters) do not expect them to
be deleted.

This patch replaces startManagingCursor() functionality.

Unfortunately Google have not released Android 3.0 source yet, so it
is hard to tell the cause.

Ready for beta testing

Work-around for UNICODE bug in ICS

- detect case-sensitive UNICODE collate
- wrap sort fields in lower() if necessary (adds 25% perf overhead to
list building). It's only happening on ICS, so impact is less noticeable
as ICS machines are generaly faster. In the longer term, consider
duplicated (lower case) fields in the summary table IF Android
perpetuates this behaviour.

Fix rare bug in synchronized transaction code

- if beginTransaction() threw an exception, the lock was retained. Now
it is unlocked and the exception rethrown.

Fixed notification icons and auto-hide

- new icons created
- notification now closes when clicked

Added various local icon copies to avoid sizing issues across OS
versions
Minor changes to add-book icon
New look bookshelves icon while waiting for professional help

deleted
First pass at new logo and hint display in style menu

added some german translations
Minor fix for launcher icon

Fix for blurring of Book list in ICS and rare locking problem on
database

- ICS does not seem to cope with transparent ListView backgrounds with a
0 cacheHint. So we set the background of the ListView directly

- Allow for the possibility of 2 threads using the same database object
and requesting transactions where at least on is an update transaction.
This should be allowed because the SynLocks will make one wait
Allow data entry in format field and provide auto-complete and list

Added new 'Format' book list style

After supporting display of formats, the data needed to be cleaned up.
Easiest approach was to add a 'Format' row style.
Handle null in books.format field
Selection dialogs are now dark text on white to make headers stand out

Support for global changes of book format via lists with the 'Format'
group
